intro: Cheiranthus junceus, commonly known as the slender wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Cheiranthus junceus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun, making it a common sight in Mediterranean regions.
